predictions.text: Alphabet (GOOGL) will close with a larger market capitalization than Apple (AAPL) for at least 10 consecutive U.S. trading sessions, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Using daily closing market capitalization computed from official closing prices and shares outstanding (as reported by major market-data providers such as Bloomberg/Refinitiv/FactSet), Alphabet's market cap must exceed Apple's on 10 consecutive trading-day closes on or before 2026-06-30 UTC.
evidence: CNBC: Alphabet’s market cap surpassed Apple’s for the first time since 2019 (2026-01-07): https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/07/alphabets-market-cap-surpasses-apples-for-first-time-since-2019.html
monitoring_signals: Daily AAPL vs GOOGL/GOOG closing market cap from Bloomberg/Refinitiv
Quarterly filings affecting share counts (10-Q/10-K) and major buyback announcements
Large AI product announcements impacting revenue expectations (Search/ads, AI models, hardware)
predictions.rationale: A single crossover has occurred; persistence depends on relative earnings revisions and AI-related sentiment/positioning through mid-2026.

predictions.text: Anthropic will be credibly reported (e.g., Reuters/Bloomberg/FT/WSJ/CNBC) to have closed a new funding round raising at least $7.5B (USD) at a post-money valuation of at least $250B, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: At least one of Reuters, Bloomberg, FT, WSJ, or CNBC reports round closure (not just talks/term sheet) with both: (1) proceeds raised >= $7.5B and (2) post-money valuation >= $250B, on or before 2026-06-30 UTC.
evidence: CNBC: Anthropic reportedly raising $10B at a $350B valuation (2026-01-07): https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/07/anthropic-funding-term-sheet-valuation.html
monitoring_signals: Follow-on reporting confirming round close vs term sheet
Investor/LP disclosures and SEC Form D (if filed) for Anthropic-related vehicles
Compute supply announcements (large GPU/TPU commitments) signaling capital deployment
predictions.rationale: Mega-round momentum exists, but valuation and close risk remain high given scale and potential regulatory/strategic investor constraints.

predictions.text: Apple will publish an Apple Card customer notice and/or updated Apple Card terms that explicitly name JPMorgan Chase (or an affiliated JPMorgan issuer bank) as the new issuer/servicer replacing Goldman Sachs, by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Apple (or Apple Card program websites/email notices) must publish updated terms, a transition FAQ, or a customer notice that explicitly identifies JPMorgan Chase (or a named JPMorgan affiliate) as issuer/servicer for Apple Card, dated on or before 2026-09-30 UTC.
evidence: CNBC: JPMorgan will become Apple Card issuer, ending Goldman’s consumer push (2026-01-07): https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/07/jpmorgan-apple-credit-card.html
monitoring_signals: Apple Card 'Terms and Conditions' and issuer disclosures
Regulatory approval indicators (OCC/FDIC/Fed disclosures if applicable)
Goldman Sachs earnings commentary on platform exits and timeline
predictions.rationale: If issuer transition is real, customer-facing legal notices typically follow within months; timing risk comes from regulatory and operational migration complexity.

predictions.text: The U.S. HHS Office for Civil Rights (OCR) will publicly open an investigation, issue a notice of inquiry, or announce a compliance action that explicitly references OpenAI’s ChatGPT Health (or OpenAI’s consumer health-record integration) and privacy/security obligations, by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: OCR (HHS) must publish (press release, bulletin, enforcement page update, or other official communication) indicating an opened investigation/inquiry or compliance action that names OpenAI/ChatGPT Health and references privacy/security obligations, on or before 2026-12-31 UTC.
evidence: OpenAI: Launch of ChatGPT Health connecting medical records and wellness apps (2026-01-07): https://openai.com/index/introducing-chatgpt-health/
monitoring_signals: OCR enforcement updates and press releases
High-profile data incident reports involving health-record integrations
State AG inquiries into consumer health privacy (WA MHMD, CA CPRA health data angles)
predictions.rationale: Consumer health-data integrations raise scrutiny risk, but OCR actions naming a specific product are relatively infrequent without a major incident.

predictions.text: Character.AI will roll out a U.S.-facing, product-default age-assurance control that includes either ID verification or selfie/biometric age estimation for users who declare they are under 18 (or for all users), by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Character.AI must publicly document (release notes, safety policy, help center, or press statement) and implement in-product in the U.S. an age-assurance mechanism that includes ID verification or selfie/biometric age estimation, effective on or before 2026-06-30 UTC.
evidence: CNBC: Google and Character.AI settlements in teen chatbot death cases (2026-01-07): https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/07/google-characterai-to-settle-suits-involving-suicides-ai-chatbots.html
monitoring_signals: Character.AI policy/help-center updates on age gating
App store release notes and UI changes indicating verification flows
Additional litigation filings demanding specific safety/age controls
predictions.rationale: Settlement and litigation pressure can drive stronger age controls, but ID/selfie-based verification is costly and may face user-retention and privacy pushback.

predictions.text: A bill will be introduced in either chamber of the U.S. Congress that restricts single-family home purchases by large institutional investors, defining eligibility using an ownership threshold of 50+ single-family homes (or an equivalent numeric threshold), by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Congress.gov must show a bill introduced on or before 2026-03-31 UTC whose text (or official summary) restricts single-family home purchases by institutional investors and includes a numeric ownership threshold of at least 50 homes (or equivalent numeric definition).
evidence: Reuters: Trump proposes banning large institutional investors from buying single-family homes (2026-01-07): https://www.reuters.com/world/us/us-will-ban-large-institutional-investors-buying-single-family-homes-trump-says-2026-01-07/
monitoring_signals: Congress.gov keyword alerts: 'institutional investor', 'single-family', 'hedge fund landlord', 'REIT purchase'
White House fact sheets translating proposal into legislative language
Housing committee hearings or draft discussion texts
predictions.rationale: Public presidential proposal often prompts a legislative vehicle quickly, even if passage odds are lower.

predictions.text: The U.S. Department of Defense will issue a formal written policy (memo, DFARS proposed rule, or contract clause guidance) that conditions at least one category of defense contracting eligibility or evaluation on limits to dividends and/or share buybacks, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: A DoD-issued document (official memo/guidance) or Federal Register notice (DFARS action) must explicitly tie contract eligibility/evaluation to restrictions or reporting requirements on dividends/buybacks for contractors, published on or before 2026-06-30 UTC.
evidence: CNBC: Trump says he will bar defense contractors from dividends and buybacks (2026-01-07): https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/07/trump-dividends-stock-buybacks-defense-companies.html
monitoring_signals: Federal Register: DFARS proposed rules mentioning dividends, buybacks, capital returns
DoD acquisition policy memos and procurement guidance updates
Earnings-call commentary from top defense primes about new contracting conditions
predictions.rationale: Political signaling is strong, but translating it into enforceable procurement policy is procedurally complex and may face legal/industry resistance.

predictions.text: BLS will report U.S. JOLTS job openings (seasonally adjusted) below 7.5 million in at least one monthly release, by 2026-07-07 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: In any JOLTS release published on or before 2026-07-07 UTC, the 'Job Openings' level (seasonally adjusted, total nonfarm) must be < 7.5 million for the referenced month.
evidence: BLS JOLTS: openings and hires little changed in November; separations steady (2026-01-07): https://www.bls.gov/news.release/archives/jolts_01072026.htm
monitoring_signals: Monthly JOLTS releases (openings, quits, hires)
Conference Board labor differential and Indeed job postings indices
Fed communications emphasizing labor-market rebalancing
predictions.rationale: A cooling-but-stable labor market makes a dip below 7.5M plausible within two quarters, but re-acceleration risk remains if growth surprises.

predictions.text: The U.S. federal government (EPA, FEMA, HHS/CDC, or HUD) will announce a competitive grant program totaling at least $500 million aimed at wildfire-smoke exposure mitigation (e.g., indoor air filtration, clean air shelters, smoke forecasting/monitoring), by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: A U.S. federal agency must publish a NOFO/FOA or official announcement on or before 2026-09-30 UTC for a competitively awarded grant program (not formula funding) with total program funding >= $500 million, with primary purpose described as wildfire smoke/air-quality exposure mitigation.
evidence: ScienceDaily: Research suggests wildfire pollution may be far higher than estimated (2026-01-07): https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2026/01/260107012114.htm
monitoring_signals: Grants.gov searches: 'wildfire smoke', 'air filtration', 'clean air shelter'
EPA and FEMA resilience funding announcements; state/federal smoke preparedness initiatives
Severe wildfire season indicators (drought indices, early large-fire activity)
predictions.rationale: If wildfire smoke health costs are revised upward, agencies may respond with sizable mitigation funding; budget constraints and program design could delay awards.
